workflow.name: Inserting Brevo contact reports into NocoDB
workflow.description:
## **Overview**

This n8n workflow automatically **retrieves Brevo contact reports** and **inserts summarized engagement data into NocoDB**.  
It groups campaign activity by email, creating a clean, unified record that includes sent, delivered, opened, clicked, and blacklisted events.  
This setup keeps your CRM or marketing database synchronized with the latest Brevo email performance data.

---

## ‚úÖ **Tasks**

* ‚è∞ Runs automatically on schedule or manually  
* üåê Fetches contact activity data from **Brevo API**  
* üß© Groups all campaign activity per email  
* üíæ Inserts summarized data into **NocoDB**  
* ‚öôÔ∏è Keeps engagement metrics synced between **Brevo** and **NocoDB**  

---

## **üõ† How to Use**

* üß± **Prepare your NocoDB table**  
  Create a table with fields for: **email**, **messagesSent**, **delivered**, **opened**, **clicked**, **done**, and **blacklisted**.  

* üîë **Connect your Brevo credentials**  
  Add your **Brevo API Key** in the **HTTP Request** node to fetch contact data securely.  

* üßÆ **Review the Code Nodes**  
  These nodes group contact activity by email and prepare a single dataset for insertion.  

* üöÄ **Run or schedule the workflow**  
  Execute it manually or use a **Schedule Trigger** to automate the data sync process.  

---

## **üìå Notes**

* üóÇ Make sure the **field names** in NocoDB match those used in the workflow.  
* üîê Keep your **Brevo API Key** secure and private.  
* ‚öôÔ∏è The workflow can be expanded to include additional fields or filters.  
* üìä Use the data for engagement analytics, segmentation, or campaign performance tracking.

workflow.name: Insert Brevo Contact Report into NocoDB

nodes.name: Check if Email is Inserted Before

parameters.content:
## **Insert Emails from NocoDB**

This node retrieves email data from your **NocoDB** table.  
It collects the following fields:

- **email**  
- **messagesSent**  
- **delivered**  
- **opened**  
- **clicked**  
- **done**  
- **blacklisted**

## **Get Brevo Contact Report**

This node connects to the **Brevo API** to retrieve detailed contact engagement reports.  
It fetches activity data for each email, including:

- **messagesSent**  
- **delivered**  
- **opened**  
- **clicked**  
- **blacklisted**

## **Split Out Nodes**

This section splits the **Brevo contact report data** into separate branches.  
Each branch processes a specific type of result before updating records in **NocoDB**.

## **Code Nodes**

These nodes use JavaScript to **group and organize Brevo contact data** by email.  
They combine multiple campaign records into a single entry for each contact, preparing the data for insertion into **NocoDB**.

main.node: Check if Email is Inserted Before

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
